results.description: Uses beta_last_30_days_spy momentum to capture stocks whose beta is rising short-term relative to recent past. SUGGESTION1: used a single high-quality datafield (beta_last_30_days_spy) to keep signal clean; SUGGESTION2: no vector fields present; SUGGESTION3: coverage >0.6 so ts_backfill not applied; SUGGESTION4: field has moderate user/alpha counts so signal is common. KEEP_IN_MIND: implementation uses 2 operators and 1 datafield (within limits). Confidence set to 0.60 based on typical beta momentum reliability.

Long stocks with lower long-term beta vs short-term beta (reversion of beta). SUGGESTION1: used two datafields (beta_last_360_days_spy, beta_last_30_days_spy) to compare horizons; SUGGESTION2: no vector fields; SUGGESTION3: both coverages >0.6 so no ts_backfill; SUGGESTION4: beta_last_360_days_spy has high userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: uses 2 datafields and 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.65 because cross-horizon beta gaps have persistent predictive power.

Identify stocks whose short-term correlation to SPY increases suddenly (possible momentum or crowding). SUGGESTION1: used correlation_last_30_days_spy and correlation_last_90_days_spy to capture change; SUGGESTION2: no vector fields; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK so no backfill; SUGGESTION4: correlation fields have reasonable user/alphaCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: implementation uses 2 fields and 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.55 reflecting mixed evidence on correlation breakouts.

Trade on reversion in unsystematic_risk_last_360_days: fade spikes in idiosyncratic risk. SUGGESTION1: single high-quality field unsystematic_risk_last_360_days used per SUGGESTION1; SUGGESTION2: not applicable; SUGGESTION3: no backfill needed; SUGGESTION4: field has very high user/alphaCount so signal is well understood but actionable. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.75 due to robust historic performance of idiosyncratic-risk mean-reversion.

Look for stocks where beta rises but correlation falls (structural idiosyncratic load shift). SUGGESTION1: used beta_last_60_days_spy and correlation_last_60_days_spy together; SUGGESTION2: no vector fields; SUGGESTION3: coverages OK; SUGGESTION4: both fields have decent user/alpha counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.58 because divergence events are less frequent but informative.

Capture trend in systematic_risk_last_30_days as a momentum signal (rising market sensitivity). SUGGESTION1: single field used to keep implementation compact; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage >0.6; SUGGESTION4: field has moderate userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field and 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.52 as systematic risk trends can be noisy.

Go long stocks with unusually low short-term correlation to SPY relative to peers (diversifiers). SUGGESTION1: use correlation_last_30_days_spy and quantile to form cross-sectional bucket; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: correlation field userCount moderate. KEEP_IN_MIND: uses 1 datafield and 1 cross-sectional operator. Confidence set to 0.62 for diversifier premium.

Favor stocks with stable beta: low ts_std_dev of beta across 90 days. SUGGESTION1: use beta_last_90_days_spy and ts_std_dev(ts_backfill not needed); SUGGESTION2: no vector fields; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: beta field has solid user/alpha counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field and 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.60 because stability often reduces unexpected exposures.

Scale beta by unsystematic risk to prefer stocks with high beta but low idiosyncratic noise. SUGGESTION1: used beta_last_60_days_spy and unsystematic_risk_last_60_days; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage >0.6; SUGGESTION4: both fields have good user counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields and 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.68 since adjusting exposures by idiosyncratic risk improves sharpe.

Identify stocks where short-term correlation to SPY increases relative to long-term correlation signaling accelerating market sensitivity. SUGGESTION1: used correlation_last_30_days_spy and correlation_last_360_days_spy; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: both coverages >0.6; SUGGESTION4: correlation_last_360_days_spy has good userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.57.

Capture momentum in unsystematic risk but winsorize extremes to avoid outliers. SUGGESTION1: single field unsystematic_risk_last_90_days used; SUGGESTION2: NA; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: high user/alpha counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: used winsorize + ts_zscore (2 operators). Confidence set to 0.70 because idiosyncratic risk persistence is strong when winsorized.

Normalize beta by its time-series volatility to prefer stable exposures. SUGGESTION1: beta_last_90_days_spy used with ts_std_dev; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: beta field used due to moderate user/alpha. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.63.

Prefer stocks where unsystematic_risk exceeds systematic risk (idiosyncratic opportunities). SUGGESTION1: used systematic_risk_last_60_days and unsystematic_risk_last_60_days; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: unsystematic field has strong counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields, 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.66.

Enter when correlation_last_60_days_spy reaches a recent minimum (mean-revert to higher correlation). SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: field has good alphaCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: uses ts_arg_min and tradeable ranking (2 operators). Confidence set to 0.54 as minimum-based signals can be noisy.

results.idea: Beta spread across mid and long horizon
results.description: Capture gradual structural beta shift: beta_last_90_days_spy minus beta_last_360_days_spy (positive indicates recent pickup). SUGGESTION1: two fields used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: okay; SUGGESTION4: both fields have moderate user counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields and 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.61.

Confidence set to 0.64.

Select stocks whose beta is high but correlation low (beta driven by idiosyncratic factors). Confidence set to 0.67.

Detect sudden jumps in systematic_risk_last_30_days via ts_max_diff to capture regime changes. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: field userCount moderate. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field and 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.50 because regime-change timing is hard.

Cross-sectional zscore of beta_last_60_days_spy to target relative high/low beta stocks. SUGGESTION1: single field with cross-sectional operator; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: moderate usage. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field and 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.56.

Go long stocks where correlation_last_360_days_spy is unusually low but short-term correlation rising (entry into improving diversifiers). KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields, 3 operators. Confidence set to 0.60.

Prefer stocks with high unsystematic risk but low beta (idiosyncratic growth); compute ratio unsystematic_risk_last_90_days / (beta_last_90_days_spy+eps). SUGGESTION1: both fields used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: no backfill needed; SUGGESTION4: unsystematic field strong userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.69.

Identify stocks whose correlation last 30-day has decayed relative to 60-day mean — expect reversion up. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.55.

Capture acceleration in beta by computing ts_delta of ts_delta (second derivative) to find rapid exposure shifts. SUGGESTION1: beta_last_60_days_spy used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: moderate counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.53.

Buy stocks in lowest quantile of unsystematic_risk_last_360_days (stable idiosyncratic risk). SUGGESTION1: single field and quantile used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: field high userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.65.

KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields and 3 operators (zscore + add). Confidence set to 0.62.

Favor stocks with beta that diverges from industry median (requires grouping—use as group parameter externally). Measure persistence of unsystematic spikes by ts_product or ts_ir to find sustained idiosyncratic regimes. SUGGESTION1: use unsystematic_risk_last_90_days; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: coverage OK; SUGGESTION4: high counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field and ts_ir (1 operator). Confidence set to 0.67.

Exclude stocks with highly unstable beta by combining ts_std_dev and absolute beta. SUGGESTION1: beta_last_30_days_spy used with ts_std_dev; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK; SUGGESTION4: moderate counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.59.

Downweight names with extreme correlation ranks (avoid crowding). SUGGESTION1: use quantile(correlation_last_60_days_spy) for cross-sectional bucketing; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK; SUGGESTION4: adequate counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.60.

results.idea: Unsystematic risk low but rising zscore

Score = ts_zscore(beta_last_30_days_spy) - ts_zscore(correlation_last_30_days_spy) to find rising beta not explained by correlation. SUGGESTION1: two fields used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK; SUGGESTION4: moderate counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields, 3 operators. Confidence set to 0.60.

When systematic_risk_last_360_days rises above long-term mean, lower beta exposure (implemented as signal filter). During periods where correlation_last_30_days_spy rises across the cross-section, reduce exposures (signal uses cross-sectional mean externally). Favor names with low unsystematic_risk_last_360_days and low recent variability to reduce drawdown. SUGGESTION1: single field with ts_std_dev and quantile; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK; SUGGESTION4: strong counts. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.66.

Scale beta_last_30_days_spy by long-run ts_std_dev to favor stable exposures. SUGGESTION1: beta_last_30_days_spy used with ts_std_dev; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.6.

Use correlation_last_90_days_spy to select pairs of low-correlated names externally; here provide per-name score = reverse(correlation). SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.58.

Find names where unsystematic_risk_last_60_days is rising while systematic_risk_last_60_days falls (idiosyncratic-driven). SUGGESTION1: both fields used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK; SUGGESTION4: unsystematic field strong. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.7.

Scale beta_last_60_days_spy to booksize to normalize allocations across names. SUGGESTION1: single field and scale operator used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.55.

Short names in highest correlation_last_60_days_spy quantile expecting reversion. SUGGESTION1: single field and quantile used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.53.

Construct long low-beta, short high-beta using quartiles of beta_last_360_days_spy (bucketed). SUGGESTION1: single field and bucket used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.58.

Long names where unsystematic_risk_last_30_days has suddenly dropped (ts_delta negative) expecting rebound. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.62.

Use ts_mean(correlation_last_30_days_spy,5) to smooth and then rank cross-sectionally for allocation. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.56.

Avoid names with high kurtosis of beta (extreme tail behavior) using ts_kurtosis(beta_last_90_days_spy). SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.59.

results.idea: Unsystematic risk normalized by long-term mean
results.description: Divide unsystematic_risk_last_60_days by its 360-day mean to spot relative increases. SUGGESTION1: single field with ts_mean used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.67.

zscore of beta_last_30_days_spy relative to 360-day distribution to detect extremeness. SUGGESTION1: single field and ts_zscore used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.6.

Prefer rising correlation_last_30_days_spy but scaled down by ts_std_dev to focus on consistent moves. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.58.

Cross-sectional zscore of ts_delta(unsystematic_risk_last_90_days) to find strong movers. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 field, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.7.

Find names where beta_last_360_days_spy is rising relative to 360-day mean (gradual re-rating). SUGGESTION1: single field and subtract used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.58.

Use correlation_last_60_days_spy percentile bucket to allocate to low-correlation names. SUGGESTION1: single field with bucket; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.61.

Compare unsystematic_risk_last_360_days to mean unsystematic risk cross-sectionally (zscore) to find relative idiosyncratic plays. SUGGESTION1: single field and zscore used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.68.
Detect local spikes in beta_last_30_days_spy using ts_arg_max over 30 days. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.52.
Compute ts_zscore of smoothed correlation (ts_mean of 5 days) to reduce noise. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.57.

Downweight names whose unsystematic_risk_last_30_days spikes during market stress (pair with systematic_risk threshold). SUGGESTION1: unsystematic_risk_last_30_days and systematic_risk_last_30_days used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 fields, 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.65.
Avoid names with high ts_kurtosis(beta_last_90_days_spy) indicating tail risk. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.6.

Compute ts_ir(correlation_last_60_days_spy,30) to favor consistent correlation moves. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.56.

Fade names with sudden unsystematic spikes but only if the spike is isolated (ts_count_nans not used here). SUGGESTION1: single field ts_max_diff used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.7.

Score = ts_delta(beta_last_60_days_spy,5) normalized by ts_std_dev to find durable accelerations. SUGGESTION1: single field used; SUGGESTION2: none; SUGGESTION3: OK. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 operators. Confidence set to 0.58.
